Class DsaMaxHeap<ElemType>

java.lang.Object
com.ambiguousdino.datastructures.implementation.tree.DsaMaxHeap<ElemType>
Type Parameters:
ElemType - The type of element stored in the heap
All Implemented Interfaces:
DsaHeap<ElemType>, DsaTree<ElemType>
public class DsaMaxHeap<ElemType> extends Object implements DsaHeap<ElemType>
Class for implementing a max heap

  • Method Details

    • size

      public int size()
      Description copied from interface: DsaTree
      Returns the number of elements in the tree. It is guaranteed that size() == 0 if and only if isEmpty() returns true.
      Specified by:
      size in interface DsaTree<ElemType>
      Returns:
      the size of the tree

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Description copied from interface: DsaTree
      Checks whether the tree is empty. A tree is considered empty if it has no elements. It is guaranteed that isEmpty() returns true if and only if size() == 0.
      Specified by:
      isEmpty in interface DsaTree<ElemType>
      Returns:
      true if the tree contains no elements, false otherwise

    • insert

      public void insert(ElemType element)
      Description copied from interface: DsaHeap
      Inserts the specified element into the heap. Postconditions:
      • The element is added to the heap, maintaining the heap invariant.
      • DsaTree.size() increases by one.
      Specified by:
      insert in interface DsaHeap<ElemType>
      Specified by:
      insert in interface DsaTree<ElemType>
      Parameters:
      element - the element to be inserted into the heap

    • extract

      public ElemType extract()
      Description copied from interface: DsaHeap
      Extracts and returns the top element from the heap. -- Largest element for max-heap -- Smallest element for min-heap The top element is the root of the heap and is removed from the heap, maintaining the heap invariant.
      Specified by:
      extract in interface DsaHeap<ElemType>
      Returns:
      the extracted top element

    • peek

      public ElemType peek()
      Description copied from interface: DsaHeap
      Returns, but does not remove, the top (min or max) element of the heap.
      Specified by:
      peek in interface DsaHeap<ElemType>
      Returns:
      the top element of the heap
